result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandra L Schlicher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Original Exhibits 41 through 45 received from Judge Bauer's office

Defendant appeared w/Atty Roger Klopp, Atty Vytas Salna appeared for Aspen Counseling w/Barry Erath.  Witnesses sequestered.  Barry Erath sworn, testimony continues; exhibit list continues.  Court in recess for 5 minutes.  Case recalled; appearances same, testimony continues.  Atty Salna heard and moves Exhibits 10, 11, 12, 41, 43 as received; Court receives same.  Valori Menderala sworn/testifies.  Court in recess for 5 minutes.  Case recalled; appearance same, testimony continues.  Atty Salna moves exhibits 16-30, 36, 37, 42, & 44 as received; Court receives same.  Discussion held.  Court receives all exhibits.  Discussion held on exhibit 44 misc. payments from office account.  Court disallows portions on exhibits 44 as stated on record; $3,777.05 remaining amount ordered.  Discussion held on exhibit 16 cash payments.  Court heard and clear embezzlement; full amount listed is owing $19,494.54.  Discussion held on EOBs benefits.  Court heard and orders whole amount $48,614.13.  Discussion held on credit card and checks - exh 37.  Court heard and orders on exhibit 37; orders- $200 off total and orders 75% on that exhibit remaining balance or $6,536.31.  Discussion held on research money for researching embezzlements.  Court head and orders all $15,882.56.  Discussion on legal costs incurred.  Court heard and cannot order legal fees; orders atty fees $500 as normally ordered in a civil case.  Court heard and state total $102,073.84.  Defendant has already paid $17,000.  Court credits that amount.  Court orders final amount of $85,073.84.  Court orders that amount be added to the JOC.  Discussion held on insurance proceeds already paid - Court orders proceeds to go to business and Mr. Erath.  Discussion held on payment.  Court heard, defendant should make good faith effort to get this paid.  If not paid agent can extend supervision.

Case called 10:06 a.m. Defendant Sandra L Schlicher in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court recessed for Information to be drafted. Case recalled at 10:13 a.m., same appearances. Information filed, reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Statement by victim. Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 3 years probation, conditions: 1 year jail starting Jan. 20, 2015 at 7 p.m., may transfer to Waupauca Cty. Jail. Huber granted under jail rules. No good time. Restitution to be determined at a hearing. $17,000 paid up front. $518 court costs. DNA sample to be submitted. Defendant not to work in a business setting where she handles money or is responsible for their money. No jail credit.  Ct. 2 read in and dismissed. Court adjourned 10:51 a.m.

Defendant Sandra L Schlicher in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  State requested a different date for arraignment, due to a possible change in charges.  Atty Stamman requested another pretrial to discuss the possible changes.  30 Days for information to be filed.  Judge Bauer will be appearing by video for the arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
